summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 discussing travel approval and logistical planning for the arrest of a target (Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. It reveals the FBI tracking her phone to New Hampshire and shifting operational plans.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the arrest operation in the Epstein investigation; her phone's historical location data indicates she is in New Hampshire.

events.title: FBI planning for Maxwell arrest operation
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss requesting and approving travel for an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell, initially believed to be in Massachusetts, with plans to shift to New Hampshire based on phone location data.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
Historical phone location data indicated Maxwell was in New Hampshire, causing the FBI to shift operational plans.
The operation involved moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
The arrest team planned to drive, possibly escort the target back to New York, and incurred estimated expenses for hotel, per diem, and parking.
An FBI supervisor from the Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit was involved and requested notification to submit a Significant Case Notification (SCN) upon arrest.
